title: Did anyone get placed in a good spot after provisionals?
body: I would just like to know if anyone was put in a semi reasonable place based on provisionals. Personally I was placed in bronze 2 after winning 7/10 games with either just reasonable stats or I contributed immensely to winning as shown by stats. And both a combination of not having time to play and getting frustrated with the players at that level has left my in bronze 3. And I am definitely not a bronze level player.

replies.body: Ranked is easy to climb until you get where you should be....I was Bronze 4 at the start of season 3 and was mad because I thought it was my team holding me back. Then I took at step back and looked at my own play and easily climbed into Gold 1 in two months. It is easy to climb if you focus on your own play and don't blame team mate. If you are stuck after a large amount of matches, that generally means you found your skill level.

> [{quoted}](name=Generalbeak,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=vmpmpXnN,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-06-26T01:51:56.089+0000)
>
> Ranked is easy to climb until you get where you should be....I was Bronze 4 at the start of season 3 and was mad because I thought it was my team holding me back. Then I took at step back and looked at my own play and easily climbed into Gold 1 in two months. It is easy to climb if you focus on your own play and don't blame team mate. If you are stuck after a large amount of matches, that generally means you found your skill level.

I specifically worded that statement " getting frustrated with players at that level " to avoid exactly what I feel you are talking about. I don't think I lose because " my backpack just isn't big enough " or any other typical excuse for playing poorly. Ever game I attempt to further the teams play by staying positive, thinking ahead, and even giving advice to areas that are struggling, and I find that people tend to ignore help. Whether you think so or not winning a game by yourself is not realistic, and bad teammates do exist. Is every game I lose due to my teammates? Hell no, but the majority of them are indeed the result of toxic behavior, negativity and refusal to communicate or lack of an open mind to find problems.
I was in Gold V last season, and if I remember correctly, I went 5-5 in my provisionals and placed in Silver II.
D; i miss you nami player you deleted me i am heartbroken </3

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=vmpmpXnN,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-06-26T01:45:13.875+0000)
>
> I was in Gold V last season, and if I remember correctly, I went 5-5 in my provisionals and placed in Silver II.

lmao silver...

Give up.

Cause you are gold I doesnt mean you get to splash other peoples dream of trying to get higher elo, it just shows how mean you can be, oh and btw you still have a long way to be a ''pro'', gl on ranked
I'm actually Plat V now. :3
Honestly I want to play SR and ranked but I feel id just cause the team to lose. Im a good player in ARAM but that's ARAM. Any suggestions on what to do or where to start?

> [{quoted}](name=Baunjo,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=vmpmpXnN,comment-id=000a0000,timestamp=2015-06-27T15:43:18.623+0000)
>
> Yes. Play normals and learn every role, not that you have to like them, but just learn them. Also try and have atleast 5 champions per role that you play WELL, they dont have to be perfect and you dont have to like them but you need to be flexible in ranked. Another important thing is watching streamers and youtubers that give good commentary. One of my favorite youtubers to watch for LoL advice is FoxDropLoL because I main jungle and he is very good. Finally, though the thread is not perfect, search for my thread called " Objective Control " and read that thoroughly, it will give you an idea of how to work towards bringing a game to a close and the concept of trading objectives.
Hey, I would like to say thank you for the advice. I will start watching these streams and I will read your thread soon. Once again thank you!
np

No.
I sucked when I started and got placed in Silver 5. I was probably like Bronze IV material at the time. Just above completely and utterly shit but not good at all.
I went 8-2 in my provisionals and got b4.  I was silver 1 last season before my laptop broke and I decayed.

My main went something like 6-4 (plat last season) placed Gold 5.

My smurf with 0 ranked games ever went 10-0 and placed Plat 2...
That is actually funny.

I was Silver 1 in Season 3 and got straight into Gold 5 last year after winning most of my placements. I've only just started placements for this year (not a fan of ranked personally so I avoid it usually) both games went 8/1 so far but sadly in the second game our Vlad rage quit so we lost anyway. Still 8/1 is a great way to end a 4v5 so hopefully the system takes that into account.
Gold 2 peak last season, ended at Gold 4, now climbing from Silver 2. Fairly fine, though the climb itself sucks.
I got placed in Silver IV. Feels about right- now in Silver III.
i went 9/10 was silver 5 or bronze 1 last season and got placed in bronze 5 :/. my friend who had about 150 wins got placed in silver 5 after going 2/10

Just checking out some of your games I can see that your CS is extremely low and you die a lot, if you work on those things you will be able to climb easily.

I got placed in gold 5 after losing 8/10 games from plat 3 so it was pretty accurate but it was easy to climb because I was above a gold player.

> [{quoted}](name=Dedrius,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=vmpmpXnN,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-06-26T01:11:11.808+0000)
>
> Just checking out some of your games I can see that your CS is extremely low and you die a lot, if you work on those things you will be able to climb easily.
> 
> I got placed in gold 5 after losing 8/10 games from plat 3 so it was pretty accurate but it was easy to climb because I was above a gold player.

I could easily climb if it weren't for the fact that i haven't been able to play for months at a time... and besides i main jungle, that atones for my general poor csing skills. And besides the point of this thread was merely to see if I was not the only one placed in a low bracket. Once I have the time I will climb just fine

I was gold IV  last season. I was fearing that I would be placed on a lower rank such as Silver, on other hand, I've heard of people that actually managed to get into an higher rank.

In the end, I just managed to be placed on the exact same rank and division.
Places s1 and 2 friends placed g5, all of us were g5 last year.
